ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Are you then amazed at this discourse
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Are you astonished at this news,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Will you, then, wonder at this?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Does this statement seem strange to them
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So are you surprised at this fact?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Do you then wonder at this reci- tation
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Do you then wonder at this announcement?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Do you then marvel at this discourse,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Marvel ye then at this statement,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Do you then find these tidings strange?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: At this discourse then marvel ye?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Will you then wonder at this discourse,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Do ye then wonder at this recital?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Do you then wonder at this recital (the Quran)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Do you marvel then at this discourse (the Koran)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Do you marvel at this discourse?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then at this statement do you wonder?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:59] Do you then marvel, in denial, at this discourse, the Qur’ān,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Marvel ye then at this statement) He says: are you mocking-and it is said: are you denying-this Qur'an which Muhammad (pbuh) recites to you, people of Mecca,
